AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.undocumented aliens: individuals being transported and dropped off along Farm-to-Market Road 2050, walking east towards Highway 16 to be picked up by another vehicle heading north
Defendant associated with a white Malibu sedan and charged with transporting undocumented aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle: White Malibu sedan associated with RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR., stopped by United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino near Farm-to-Market Road 2050, transporting undocumented aliens, including five passengers and two in the trunk, driven on a road primarily used by local residents and oil company employees, registered to Hertz Rental Car Company
Defendant who waived his rights and provided a timeline of events, but changed details of his story several times during the interview
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle: Black Dodge pickup truck associated with IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR., stopped at the Freer Immigration Checkpoint, also referred to as "a black one", heading towards Highway 59 and then turning southbound onto Farm-to-Market Road 2050, with a camper, either dark blue or black in color, involved in a traffic stop by Officer Reymundo Reyes, where IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. exhibited nervous behavior during the stop, registered to Corinth, Texas
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle and IGN: Vehicles involved in the incident, including a white Malibu sedan and a black Dodge pickup truck, stopped near the Border Patrol Station Parking Lot, attempting to avoid the Hebbronville Checkpoint, within fifty miles of the Mexico border, with out-of-town registrations
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jorge Luis Trevino: United States Border Patrol Agent Jorge Luis Trevino, testifying about the traffic on Farm-to-Market Road 2050, recognizing most vehicles as belonging to farmers and oil field workers, followed the black Dodge pickup truck for around five minutes
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: Law enforcement agency involved in the incident
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Officer Reymundo Reyes: Freer Police Department officer who conducted a traffic stop on IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s vehicle and observed IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.'s nervous behavior during the stop
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Marco Montemayor: Special Agent for the United States Department of Homeland Security, conducted an interview with IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and ensured he understood his Miranda rights
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Department of Homeland Sec: Law enforcement agency involved in the incident, with agents conducting interviews and ensuring defendants understand their rights
